definition: camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for
to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct

sentences.english: And discusses the various periods of pine construction development.
sentences.chinese: 並論述了各個時期松景營建的發展脈絡。

sentences.english: Taking refuge in the Dharma, save the ambrosial water and set up a waterworks in yourselves.
sentences.chinese: 皈依法，儲蓄甘露法水，爲自己營建了自來水廠。

sentences.english: The construction industry has been badly hurt by nationalisation.
sentences.chinese: 營建業已經在收歸國有的過程受傷慘重。

sentences.english: They have found areas suitable for seed orchard purposes.
sentences.chinese: 他們找到了適於營建種子園的地區。

sentences.english: Chinese construction firms have won contracts across Africa and eastern Europe.
sentences.chinese: 中國的營建公司贏得了非洲和東歐各地的合約。

sentences.english: They will put up a monument in the middle of the park.
sentences.chinese: 他們將在公園大旨營建一座慶賀碑。

sentences.english: Ministry of the Interior Certification Authority Certification …
sentences.chinese: 內政部營建署城鄉發展分署函。

definition: to cut (a canal, tunnel, well etc)
to carry out large scale construction
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
public/publicly (owned, financed, operated etc)/run by the state
Huwei town in Yunlin county 雲林縣|云林县[Yun2 lin2 xian4], Taiwan
